alert.note: Alert for Adams; Highland; Pike; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ADAMS, WESTERN PIKE, SOUTHEASTERN HIGHLAND AND NORTHWESTERN SCIOTO COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near West Union, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... West Union, Peebles, Seaman, Pike Lake, Kincaid Springs, Rarden, Cherry Fork, Sinking Spring, Poplar Grove, Dunkinsville, Elm Grove, State Route 348 at State Route 125, May Hill, Serpent Mound, Locust Grove, Buchanan, Ladd, Mount Joy, Cedar Mills and Smoky Corners. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
